thread.title: Foothill V-Ball roundup: It ends here
thread.title_full: Foothill V-Ball roundup: It ends here

author: Lorrie Reyes
title: Foothill V-Ball roundup: It ends here
text:
Foothill V-Ball roundup: It ends here Golden Valley gets first league victory in nearly four years Posted: October 1, 2015 10:25 p.m. Updated: October 1, 2015 10:25 p.m. Golden Valley volleyball players, from left, Sydney Overton (3) Ciera McGuinness (99), Emiley Grose (13), Cassidy Coleman (8) and Kelsey Bauer (19) celebrate during a match against Canyon on Thursday at Golden Valley High School. 
Nov. 1, 2011. 
That was the last time the Golden Valley girls volleyball team won a Foothill League game. 
But the Grizzlies changed that Thursday with a 3-1 win over Canyon — by scores of 18-25, 26-24, 26-24, 25-23 — at Golden Valley High. 
“We all came in today super excited. (We were) going up to each other high-fiving each other saying, ‘Today is the day,’” said Grizzlies outside hitter Kelsey Bauer, who had a team-high 13 kills. “We’ve been waiting for this win for a really long time and that just shows how hard we’ve worked.” 
Golden Valley (6-8 overall, 1-1 in Foothill) had to work hard to earn its first conference victory in nearly four years, by taking three straight games after dropping the opener, 25-18. 
The Grizzlies and Cowboys battled in Games 2 and 3 pushing the score to extra points. 
In the second game, Canyon (5-4, 0-2) went up by as many as six points, but Golden Valley fought back with strong serving from Bauer and Emiley Grose, who each had an ace. 
The Cowboys did help the Grizzlies out with five errors in the second half of Game 2, including a double hit to break a 24-all tie. 
“(Golden Valley) worked harder than us,” said Canyon head coach Brian Ingino. “We got nervous and we didn’t step up. We had 53 errors in the four games. It’s hard to win a game when you have that many.” 
Although the next two games were clashes of their own, the momentum was definitely on the Grizzlies’ side with the student section roaring. 
“To Canyon’s credit, they played really hard and came back a number of times,” said Golden Valley head coach Erick Beck. “But in the critical moments, our setters made good decisions with the ball and got the ball to our best hitters when they need to, and that can be the difference in the game sometimes.” 
Hart 3, West Ranch 0 
Hart swept West Ranch by scores of 25-12, 25-13, 25-21 at West Ranch High Thursday night. 
The Indians were led by Amy McKee, who tallied 10 kills. Sarah Coblentz added nine kills and three aces, while Brooke Boron knocked in four kills and racked up seven blocks. 
Madi Fay had 17 assists and Liz Baker had 17 digs for a Hart team that moves to 6-3 overall and 2-0 in conference. 
With the loss West Ranch drops to an 8-7 overall and 0-2 in league. 
Valencia 3, Saugus 1 
Valencia won in four games over Saugus on Wednesday night by scores of 25-17, 25-23, 17-25, 25-21. 
Emily Burns and Daniella Villano both had double-figure kills on the night with 15 and 10, respectively. 
Holly Pittman added nine kills, while Kelsey Knudsen had seven kills and 23 digs. 
The Vikings improved to 6-0 overall and 2-0 in league play. Saugus drops to 10-8 and 1-1 in league with the loss.
